node.title: The first medals are awarded in Beijing as competition enters full swing.
node.alt: Wu Dajing of China during a 1,000-meter short-track heat on Saturday.
node.description: The first full day of events brought an upset. Karen Chen is set to skate for the United States and Jamie Anderson aims for her third straight gold medal in snowboarding.
node.content: ["The first medals have been awarded in Beijing, with host China securing its first gold medal of the Games and an underdog competitor turning in an unlikely first-place finish.", "More gold medals are up for grabs in several events on Sunday, including in women\u2019s snowboard slopestyle, men\u2019s Alpine skiing, men\u2019s cross-country skiing, men\u2019s ski jumping, men\u2019s luge, men\u2019s speedskating and women\u2019s freestyle skiing.", "Team figure skating continues on Sunday. Karen Chen of the United States, currently ranked No. 4 in the world, is set to compete against skaters from nine other countries in the single skating event.", "But as competition heats up, the weather has been anything but warm.", "Athletes are competing in freezing temperatures at venues across Beijing, Zhangjiakou and Yanqing. The frigid conditions are made worse by blustery, cold winds, bringing additional challenges for athletes, particularly when it comes to staying limber enough to land difficult tricks or jumps while competing. In some cases, the winds have been severe enough to warrant canceling some training events.", "In Chongli, the Zhangjiakou district where nearly half of the Winter Olympics events are being held, the temperature dropped below zero degrees Fahrenheit on Saturday morning before rising to 18 degrees Fahrenheit by midafternoon. Conditions are slightly warmer in Beijing, where it has reached about 40 degrees by the afternoon, but temperatures in the mornings and evenings have been below freezing.", "Ji Chongping, Beijing\u2019s chief meteorologist, said at a news conference on Saturday that current weather conditions are normal, adding that there were likely to be strong, cold winds in the coming days."]
